title: Purge Control Valve (if fitted) - Removal

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Seat and Battery - remove - D72; D92; DB; DB2; DBX; DC3; DC4; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA; DT3; DU; DU3; DUY; DZ
Disconnect the battery, negative (black) lead first (see

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: D54; D64; DC3; DC4; DP4; D72; D92; DB2; DU3; DT3; DP3; DP2; DZ; DBX; DB; DUY; DU; DPA; DP

body.body: Side panels remove all D series except DC and DV
Remove the left hand side panel (see

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DP3; DP4; D72; D92; DB2; DU3; DT3; DF2; DF; DEX; DD2; DP2; DZ; DBX; DB; DE2; DE; DUY; DU; DPA; DP

body.body: Remove the fixing and remove the air intake duct on the left hand side of the airbox.
Note the position and orientation of the purge control valve and its bracket for installation.
If fitted, note the routing of the purge control valve fly lead for installation.
Detach the lower hose from the purge control valve, remove the fixing and detach the purge control valve and remove its bracket.
Press the wire locking device fully in and disconnect the electrical connector from the purge control valve.
Detach the upper hose and remove the purge control valve.

metadata.products: DU3; DT3; DZA; DA2; DZ; DC; DUY; DU; DP2; DPA; DP; DBX; DB

Remove the fixing and remove the air intake duct on the left hand side of the airbox.
Note the position and orientation of the purge control valve and its bracket for installation.
If fitted, note the routing of the purge control valve fly lead for installation.
Detach the lower hose from the purge control valve, remove the fixing and detach the purge control valve and remove its bracket.
Press the wire locking device fully in and disconnect the electrical connector from the purge control valve.
Detach the upper hose and remove the purge control valve.
